akn:subsection.akn:heading: Methods and requirements for achieving price stability

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Methods and requirements for achieving price stability The Congress determines that the objective of achieving reasonable price stability as soon as feasible, as set forth in section 1022(a)(3) of this title and section 1022a(a) of this title, shall be pursued by the methods and subject to the requirements of section 1022b(b) of this title.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Coordination of fiscal or monetary policies with specific targeted policies

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Coordination of fiscal or monetary policies with specific targeted policies The Congress finds that sole dependence upon fiscal or monetary policies or both to combat inflation can exacerbate both inflation and unemployment. The Congress finds that the coordinated use of fiscal and monetary policies in conjunction with specific targeted policies are necessary to combat inflation.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Policy initiation and recommendations; elements of structural policies

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Policy initiation and recommendations; elements of structural policies The President shall initiate specific policies to reduce the rate of inflation, including recommendations to the Congress where necessary, and include recommendations within the Economic Report and the President’s budget to the extent practicable.
